data.title: Renaming a file closes it
data.body:
- **Behaviour expected**: renaming a file keeps the file with it's new name opened.
- **Behaviour found**: the file is closed and you have to open it manually.
- **Main problem**: if you have not an opened project you have to search again for the file in order to open it.
- **Errors**: no error found at developer tools or running Atom from console.
- **Tested on**: Atom 0.209.0 installed on Archlinux from Aur.

Use case:
![Renaming file closes it](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/800645/8200424/1ed8fbce-14c5-11e5-9539-921e50ebfa10.jpg)

data.title: "TODO:" comments could render in a special to-do tab 🌟
Highlights don't display when empty
data.body:
Currently empty highlights are filtered out [(text-editor-presenter.coffee#L1265)](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/ebc5758d79e421f61f2b6669a886a27ee7283816/src/text-editor-presenter.coffee#L1265). This is often not appropriate.

The most trivial instance would be that 0-width searches don't show up. I've also attempted to port some Sublime Text extensions to Atom over the past couple of days ([APNG example for Firefox users](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/97b96893061473f506d82956066c4de860595e9f/687474703a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f636b6d386c356f2e706e67), and [a second for good measure](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/13fcea428dc0584ff4fd4ec703b8551215c116c0/687474703a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f667550796547362e706e67)) which also wanted this functionality. This is because they use markers to emulate "stored" cursors, which naturally includes empty cursors.

One related misfeature is that edits that touch the edge of a region are added to the region. In Sublime, they are not, which means that empty regions will stay empty. It's also a more useful behaviour generally. If empty highlights are added to Atom, it's imperative that they (at least optionally) not grow when the text to their side is edited.

data.title: Fix pane resize cursors on Windows
data.body:
Windows doesn't have `row-resize` or `col-resize` cursors, so this re-adds `ew-resize` and `ns-resize` cursors on the pane resize handle.

Addresses https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/384b88eecf6aae287f9a7a5c79a1f52dd0755494#commitcomment-11715023

Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7309

data.title: Revert "Fix inconsistency with pane resize cursors."
data.body:
Reverts atom/atom#7179 

Tree view uses `ew-resize` as shown here : https://github.com/atom/tree-view/blob/f0530bca9217ef6c2bb9fc63d815c9d153d2c898/styles/tree-view.less#L58

`row-resize` and `col-resize` don't work on windows (for whatever reason). 

Screenshots : https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7179#commitcomment-11715003

data.title: :fire: Reconsider release date
data.body: Big title with fire on it. Did I get your attention? I want to beg you, dear Atom developers, to reconsider the release date (whenever that is) of 1.0. I keep seeing issues/tasks that get their `1.0-roadmap` tag removed or just partially fixed because there is no enough time before 1.0 to properly fix this™. Atom is still lacking some basic features that even Windows's Notepad has (an piece of software that, arguably, can be called a text editor). Not supporting this or not implementing properly that in a hypothetical 1.0 release won't cause any good to Atom's reputation, probably won't cause any good to your feelings for your baby either when tens of posts start appearing, right after the 1.0 release, mocking about Atom not having X or Y. (`Atom is the new Nano!`, `Atom, nice toy, not that nice editor`, etc... You get it) I know 1.0 is not supposed to be the final and ultimate editor, but rather a point in time where the API is stable enough to be supported without BC until 2.0. I understand your point. But try to understand what users (not developers) would expect from a 1.0 release (which has been in the oven for quite some time now). On the other hand, you left the biggest changes for the very end of the sprint towards 1.0 (that is, all the text-buffer and optimizations you have been doing in the past weeks). Not that I don't trust your skills or all the unit tests you have, but one would wait a prudential amount of time before releasing anything after such a big changes. Finally, there are quite some issues that, imho, are very important (but post 1.0) and could potentially require big changes (like the char measurement system, related to ligatures in fonts). Not really sure how you're going to deal with those tasks if they require BC. Are you going to release a 2.0 just a few months later after releasing the 1.0? Or are you going to stop those BC (thus not fixing those tasks) for some time? TL;DR: Don't rush with the release just because you agreed on releasing 1.0 on a specific date. It would be better to delay the release instead of releasing a half-baked thing.

data.title: Uncaught Exception: The workspace can only contain one instance of item [object Object]
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Update to 0.209.0
2. Get deprecation message: "Style elements within text editors using the atom-text-editor::shadow selector or the .atom-text-editor.less file extension. If you want to target overlay elements, target them directly or as descendants of atom-overlay elements."
3. Attempt to split this link into another pane.

**System**: Linux Mint

data.title: Orphaned line numbers
data.body:
While screensharing with @nathansobo I got into a situation where there were some orphaned gutter elements. 

![screen shot 2015-06-16 at 2 59 54 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/8196572/e17cee08-1441-11e5-84fc-530848a900ce.png)

The gutter component only had a reference to the line numbers at the top of the screen. Not sure of exact repro steps, but i wasnt able to get rid of them.

I was working on a long md doc with softwrap on. I had been working on this doc for 2 days. The atom window had been through several resizes.

cc @as-cii maybe you have insight into this.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'element' of undefined
data.body:
This used to be in my init script:

``` coffee
atom.workspace.observeTextEditors (editor) ->
  editor.onDidSave ->
    atom.commands.dispatch(atom.workspaceView.element, 'tree-view:reveal-active-file')
    atom.views.getView(editor).focus()
```

Till recently, it worked, but now, I'm unable to find the correct change. Please help

**Atom Version**: 0.209.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'element' of undefined


data.title: Atom doesn't remember my open folders or files at all
data.body:
If I close Atom with some files and folders open, and then reopen Atom, nothing is remembered. The only thing that is open is a new blank file.

I feel like this worked at some point in the past for me, but I wasn't able to find a version that worked when I tried the specific zip files. I am currently using 0.209.0. I also tried this with --safe and the same thing happens.

I can see that the editor-giberish files are being created in the storage folder, but I never see Atom try to read those files when I launch Atom. I used Procmon to check for this access.

data.title: changing pane focus key bindings
data.body:
For some reason I can't change both keybindings for `window:focus-previous-pane` and `window:focus-next-pane`. Only the one that comes later in my `keymap.cson` gets mapped, and the one that comes first doesn't get mapped.

In this case only `window:focus-next-pane` gets mapped correctly.

```
'body':
  'ctrl-alt-cmd-left': 'window:focus-previous-pane'

'body':
  'ctrl-alt-cmd-right': 'window:focus-next-pane'
```

I'm on version 0.209.0

data.title: Clicking "Move to Trash" again before operation is complete crashes Atom
data.body: If I am deleting a file via the tree view in Atom, (right-click, "Delete") and I click the Move to Trash button twice, Atom crashes.

data.title: Dragging in an XML file on Windows tries to render it in browser
data.body:
I dragged in an XML file (with the extension `.config`) into Atom and it tried to render it in the browser. Running v. 0.209.0 on Windows Server 2008 R2.

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1463553/8191014/04fb8276-1434-11e5-8b72-87e17f80800a.png)

data.title: Renaming a file no longer renames but copies the file to a new file with a new name.
data.body: Renaming a file inside of Atom (using the sidebar -- tree view -- and if this is a direct problem there I will move this ticket there) no longer renames the actual file but copies it to a new file with a new name, leaving the file file to be manually deleted. Is this expected behavior?

data.title: HTML script tag comment issue
data.body:
Atom attempts to comment HTML script tags with JavaScript comments:

Example Code: 

``` html
<script src="script.js"></script>
```

First toggle comment (Edit > Toggle Comments/ ctrl+/)

``` html
// <script src="script.js"></script>
```

Second toggle comment (Edit > Toggle Comments/ ctrl+/)

``` html
<!-- // <script src="script.js"></script> -->
```

data.title: language-xml upgrade: missing information in GUI
data.body:
When I start Atom and search for upgrades, I see that a new version is available:

![atom upgrade language-xml](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/211020/8182915/61f5179e-1434-11e5-90e4-bdffbc301d19.png)

When I then click update, I see that it downloads stuff and then it claims success:

![atom upgrade fake success](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/211020/8182940/8be81ae2-1434-11e5-9278-7c4fc229ca35.png)

But the next time I start Atom, I'm back at square one.

Only the `apm` command gives me the full story:

![atom apm upgrade message](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/211020/8182960/bb302542-1434-11e5-98a3-ee743a117632.png)

The issue is that this message from the command line should also be represented in the UI in some way.

data.title: Dailog "Save / Cancel / Don't Save" should respond to keypresses
data.body:
Reproduce:
- open a file
- edit a file
- close tab (<kbd>Ctrl-F4</kbd> on Windows)
- press <kbd>N</kbd>

The "Save / Cancel / Don't save" dialog should respond to key-presses of <kbd>Y</kbd> and <kbd>N</kbd> since it's conceptially posing for a Yes/No/Cancel dialog. Perhaps <kbd>S</kbd> and <kbd>D</kbd> if you disagree, but if there's no way to control this dialog with the keyboard, that's bad.

(To be pedantic: Windows introduced a few version ago that by pressing <kbd>Alt</kbd> the letters that respond to <kbd>Alt</kbd>-combinations show underlined. It may be a flavour, but one one grows accustomed to.)

data.title: Find in Project add Whole Word option
data.body:
Find in Buffer has Whole Word option.
But Find in Project currently does not have that option.

data.title: Atom using a lot of memory
data.body:
Hi there, I'm running Atom version 0.209 on Ubuntu 14.04 and it's very laggy.
I have 8GB of RAM, but `htop` shows that Atom itself is eating 2GB (not counting the virtualized memory: 7.5GB).
Right now I'm ruinning 2 windows of Atom, with several files opened in each one.
Is this normal ? Is it just me or the OS I'm running ? Is there a way to make it consume less memory ?

data.title: Fold doesn't work with soft wrap
data.body:
I have soft wrap enabled and there's a block which is wrapped to the next line. When I fold it soft wrap stops working.
![fold_wrap_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/180154/8167645/4aaa7750-13a8-11e5-9776-0539649309fd.gif)

data.title: Defaults aren't customizable
data.body:
Running into issues with line endings and tabs/spaces, I have to collaborate with users using jEdit and they _absolutely_ require tabs / no spaces, and unix line endings. 

I can't configure this in Atom and my only options are plugins that need run manually; I have to change editor at work if these aren't configurable!

data.title: Open file by clicking on some/file/path:columnNumber should search among all open files first
data.body:
I can open a file in atom by clicking on some file path in console output like this:

```
# ./spec/models/user.rb:42:in `block (6 levels) in <top (required)>'
```

Click on `./spec/models/user.rb:42` -> atom open this file and travels to the line 42. 
If I have this file opened already then it just goes to the line 42. But not always.
It works like this only if this file is located in the active(last used) pane in atom. But if I'll activate (just click inside) another pane and then click on the path in console output then atom will open the file in a new tab in that pane.

I think it would be much more convenient if it will search for the file among all panes before opening the file in a new tab.
